articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Ryongrim County
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Ryongrim County

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to Ryongrim County.
					
					The county is situated on the bank of the upper reaches of Jangja River east of Jagang Province. Soldier builders and people in the county built new modern cultural and service facilities including the county house of culture, comprehensive welfare service facilities and a wading pool through a vigorous labor drive, changing its appearance beyond recognition.
					
					He first went round the wading pool.
					
					He said that the wading pool is of weighty importance in bringing up school youth and children to be pillars of the country equipped with knowledge, good moral character and good health and ensuring a happy life of the people in the county, stressing the need to manage it effectively.
					
					Then he moved to the Ryongrim County House of Culture.
					
					Going round the exterior and interior of the fashionable house built to meet the modern aesthetic need, he acquainted himself in detail with its construction and management.
					
					He underlined the need to organize well various events at the house to provide the working people with an ample cultural and emotional life and put its operation on a regular basis to meet the daily growing cultural requirements of the people.
					
					The cultural and service facilities including the newly built wading pool and the house of culture are associated with the warm sincerity devoted by servicepersons to the people, he noted, repeatedly praising the soldier builders for fully displaying the beautiful traits of helping the people and extended thanks to them.
					
					After visiting several places in Ryongrim County, he set forth tasks to spruce it up well as required by the new century.
					
					He noted that in order to build the county in a peculiar manner it is necessary to work out a long-term design and build all structures on the principle of protecting and adding to the beautiful natural scenery to suit the topographical features of the mountainous county.
					
					He underscored the need to pay deep attention to the management of the already-built buildings and service facilities and, at the same time, minutely organize service and business activities so that the people may greatly benefit from them.
					
					He expressed expectation and belief that the officials, party members and other working people of the county would positively learn from the revolutionary soldier spirit fully displayed by the servicepersons of the KPA in every site of grand socialist construction and thus perform proud labor feats in turning their county into a socialist land of bliss.
					
					He was accompanied by senior officials of the party and army Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Construction Site of Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Construction Site of Huichon Power Station

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, had a meaningful meeting with beloved people while providing field guidance to the construction site of the Huichon Power Station as soon as he returned home after his visit to Russia and China.
					
					When Kim Jong Il arrived at the Ryongrim Dam of Huichon Power Station No.1 along the newly-built Jonchon-Ryongrim dam, soldier builders enthusiastically welcomed him and extended the warmest thanks to him, representing the best wishes of all the servicepersons and people. 
					
					He acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the soldier builders.
					
					After being briefed on the construction of the Huichon Power Station and the Jonchon-Ryongrim dam road on the dam, he toured several places of the construction site.
					
					Looking at the Ryongrim dam and the large manmade lake, he said the more one watches them, the more fantastic they look. He expressed great satisfaction, noting the soldier builders successfully built great structures to go down long in the history of the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					It is a great achievement that they completed the dozens of kilometers long Jonchon-Ryongrim dam road in a matter of two months, he said, adding it is great honor and pride of the WPK to have the KPA ready to thoroughly implement any instructions of the party, going through thick and thin. He extended the special thanks of the Supreme Commander of the KPA to all the soldier builders and bestowed benevolence upon them with his loving care.
					
					He noted that the builders of the Huichon Power Station are, indeed, the frontline fighters defending the Central Committee of the WPK with human bullets and bombs, not in words only, and they are the first-line standard-bearers in the era of great surge who are taking the lead in the drive to usher in a day of the appearance of a thriving nation.
					
					The shining exploits being performed in the building of the Huichon Power Station are a striking demonstration of the inexhaustible mental power of the army and people of the DPRK and the tremendous potential of the independent national economy and, at the same time, another shining victory won by them in the struggle for resolutely smashing the vicious moves of the imperialists and the reactionaries to isolate and stifle the DPRK and safeguarding and glorifying Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses, he noted.
					
					The WPK determined to finish in a matter of three years the Huichon Power Station equal to the large nature-harnessing work which no others could ever image as it believed in the indomitable mental power of the army and the people, he said, noting with pride that the construction of the Huichon Power Station goes to clearly prove that Korean-style socialism is, indeed, the best in the world and there is nothing impossible in the world as long as the army and people of the DPRK display their inexhaustible strength. 
					
					Watching the letters "At one go" inscribed on granite, he said that when reading those letters in the distant future, the younger generation will know well about the ideological and moral traits and fighting spirit of the servicepersons of the KPA who devotedly implemented the combat order of the Party.
					
					Units of the KPA are successfully playing the role as vanguard and shock brigade on the Huichon front, too, he said, adding that the admirable feats performed by the soldiers while devoting their all to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of posterity will go down long in the history of the building of a thriving nation.
					
					After going round the construction site of the Huichon Power Station, he put forth on the spot important tasks to satisfactorily settle the problem of electricity including the construction of the power station.
					
					The construction of the hydropower station is an important work to carry out the instructions of President Kim Il Sung and to settle the electricity shortage is the most primary task for the building of a thriving nation, he said.
					
					It is the consistent policy of the WPK to build large-scale and minor hydropower stations in a big way, he said, underlining the need to continue paying primary attention to this matter in the future, too.
					
					Not a long period is left till 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, he said, calling for making great innovations and leaping forward in each worksite of the socialist front, thus showing the world what great miracles the army and people of the DPRK are working while dashing ahead like the wind toward an invincible great power.
					
					He had a photo session with the soldier builders.
					
					He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA Vice Marshal Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Jang  Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the NDC, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Ri Myong Su, minister of People's Security, and KPA Generals Kim Won Hong and Hyon Chol  Hae.

articles.title: Greeting to Malaysian King
articles.content:
Greeting to Malaysian King

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Al-Wathiqu Billah Tuanku Mizan Zainal Abidin Ibni A1-Marhum Sultan Mahmud Al-Muktafi Billah Shah, king of Malaysia, on Aug. 30 on its 54th national day.
					
					In the belief that the traditional bilateral friendly and cooperative ties would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, Kim sincerely wished the friendly people of Malaysia progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to PM and FM of Malaysia
articles.content:
Greetings to PM and FM of Malaysia

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak Tuesday on the 54th national day of Malaysia.
					
					The message wished him greater success in his work for the country's independent development and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
					
					Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his counterpart Datuk Anifah Aman on the same day.

articles.title: Japanese News Agency Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Japanese News Agency Delegation Arrives

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The  delegation of Kyodo News and its affiliated agencies headed by Satoshi Ishikawa, president of Kyodo News, arrived here Tuesday by air.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves for European Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves for European Countries

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by its Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung left here Tuesday by air to visit European countries.

articles.title: Rason-Mt. Kumgang Tourism Begins
articles.content:
Rason-Mt. Kumgang Tourism Begins

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Rason-Mt. Kumgang tourism through a sea route has begun in the DPRK on Tuesday.
					
					The cargo-passenger ship Mangyongbong will carry foreign tourists from Rason City in the northeastern tip of Korea to Mt. Kumgang, a world-famous mountain.
					
					The tourists will enjoy the scenic view of the East Sea of Korea and climb the mountain.
					
					It will take 4 nights and 5 days.
					
					The tourism including both sea and land sightseeing, the first of its kind in Korea, is drawing deep interest of foreigners.
					
					The inaugural ceremony of the tourism took place in Rason City on Tuesday, attended by officials of the Rason City People's Committee, citizens and Chinese tourists.
					
					Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					After the ceremony, Mangyongbong left Rajin Port, full of tourists. The liner will enter Kosong Port in Kangwon Province Wednesday.
					
					Reporters from China, Russia, France and the United States are aboard the ship to cover the tourism.

articles.title: Rason Directs Efforts to Tourist Development
articles.content:
Rason Directs Efforts to Tourist Development

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Rason economic and trade zone in northeast Korea has natural and geographical conditions and environment favorable for tourism.
					
					There are sea bird, seal and other game reserves, more than ten beautiful islets, bays and sand beaches in the zone.
					
					The Tourism Management Bureau of the zone has made efforts to explore new tourist resources.
					
					The launch of Chinese people's Rason tourism by their own cars on June 9 was part of the efforts. 
					
					Preparations are now under way for multinational tourism based on some tourist resources in areas bordering the DPRK, China and Russia.
					
					The bureau also plans to improve tourist facilities like hotel, recreation ground and road and build a tourist information center, folklore and national food exhibition houses and souvenir center in the zone.
					
					Many foreign businessmen and tourist experts are interested in joint development of tourist resources in the zone.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Acquaints Himself with Important Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Acquaints Himself with Important Industrial Establishments

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself on the spot with the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, the February 8 Vinalon Complex and the Ryongsong Machine Complex.
					
					He looked round various places of the complexes and convened consultative meetings there.
					
					The meetings discussed issues to further the production system relying on the indigenous technology and locally available raw materials, hasten the construction of important projects, accelerate the day of their operations and ensure satisfactory supply of necessary materials by the relevant units.
					
					Earlier, he looked round the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and organized relevant work after familiarizing himself with the production of heavy rails.

articles.title: Huge Waterway Tunnel Project Completed at Huichon Power Station Construction Site
articles.content:
Huge Waterway Tunnel Project Completed at Huichon Power Station Construction Site

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- KCNA released a detailed report on the completion of the huge waterway tunnel of the Huichon Power Station in the DPRK.
					
					It says:
					
					The army and people of the DPRK completed waterway tunnel extending dozens of kilometers in the wake of building huge dams in the deep mountainous areas in the upper reaches of the River Jangja and the River Chongchon in just over 700 days.
					
					The completion of the project provided a sure guarantee for finishing the construction of the power station ahead of schedule.
					
					In March Juche 98(2009) leader Kim Jong Il visited the construction site and specified the orientation and ways for finishing the waterway tunnel project at an early date and saw to that revolutionary measures were taken. Later he visited the construction sites several times, instilling strength and courage into the builders.
					
					The builders started the project from April Juche 98(2009). They worked the miracle of paving the Toyang Pass 1500 meters above the sea level, a project that had to be finished before the construction of the tunnel, in just 12 days.
					
					When came to the excavation of main waterway tunnel, the soldiers of the Korean People's Army halved the total length of the tunnel from the original design out of bold initiative and increased the tunneling speed 6 times, 8 times at maximum.
					
					Members of shock brigade teams of ministries, national institutions and provincial brigades launched an offensive in the same revolutionary soldier spirit as displayed by the soldiers. The Pyongyang city brigade set the course of the tunnel in a rational way, sparing six month period.
					
					The brigades of North Phyongan Province and the Ministry of Construction and Building Materials Industry introduced new blowing-up method despite difficult conditions.
					
					Thanks to the active drive waged by the builders defying water dripping from the ceiling and crumbling rocks, the digging of the whole section of huge waterway tunnel was finished in November last year.
					
					The soldier builders finished huge follow-up projects such as coating the waterway tunnel as well as hundreds of meters of iron pipes and burying them and the project of a surge tank which requires high technique in a matter of just a few months.
					
					The waterway project central command and brigades of ministries, national institutions and provinces dug dozens of meters of waterway tunnel everyday in the spirit of collectivism. 
					
					A great number of officials, working people and youth and students across the country as well as families of KPA officers rendered sincere material and moral help and conducted economic agitation activities inside pit faces, encouraging the builders.
					
					By early July the project of sealing the tunnel was also completed. It took at least 800 days to complete the huge waterway tunnel.

articles.title: Porcelain Creative Group in DPRK
articles.content:
Porcelain Creative Group in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The porcelain creative group of the Mansudae Art Studio in the DPRK is well known to the world for creating famous porcelains including Koryo celadon. 
					
					"Celadon vase inlaid with a blue dragon pattern" made by People's Artist Han Kyong Su and "Celadon vase patterned with cloud and crane" by Merited Artist U Chol Ryong won the gold prize and first prize respectively at an international porcelain fair held a few years ago. The fair was attended by more than 700 organs from some 30 countries and regions.  
					
					Another People's Artist Sin Hyon Su won the top prize at an international porcelain fair drawing over 500 000 pieces.
					
					The three porcelains attracted admiration from visitors.
					
					Some of the members of the porcelain creative group are People's Artists and Merited Artists.

articles.title: Chilbo, Scenic Mountain of Korea
articles.content:
Chilbo, Scenic Mountain of Korea

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Mt. Chilbo, known as one of the six most celebrated mountains of Korea, is standing in Myongchon County, North Hamgyong Province. It, covering about 250 square kilometers, has many peaks, some 1 000 meters high. The highest peak is 1 103-meter-high Sangmae. 
					
					The name of the onshore mountain means seven treasures. 
					
					The mountain boasts of many big and small waterfalls, pools, scenic spots, fantastic rocks and cliffs, as well as cultural relics, including the Kaesim Temple.
					
					The autumn-tinted and snow-clad mountain is a spectacular sight.
					
					It is divided into Inner Chilbo, Outer Chilbo and Sea Chilbo, with hotels, rooms for rent and beach resort available for tourists.
					
					The mountain has become a famous tourist destination under deep care of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Manwoldae, Korea's Cultural Heritage
articles.content:
Manwoldae, Korea's Cultural Heritage

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Manwoldae, a ruined royal palace of Koryo (918-1392), the first unified state of Korea, is located at the south foot of Mt. Songak in Kaesong City.
					
					Manwoldae, built in 919 in the early period of Koryo, is believed to have covered more than 1 250 000 square meters.
					
					Manwoldae was characterized by several buildings constructed on high terraces to look like a group of structures with their roofs seen in tiers.
					
					What is noticeable is that the royal palace was very similar to that of Koguryo (277 B.C.-668 A.D.) in architectural structure and construction.
					
					Manwoldae is one of the valuable cultural heritages indicative of the creative talent and wisdom of the Koryo people who succeeded to Koguryo.
					
					The palace was burnt down by foreign aggressors.

articles.title: Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site
articles.content:
Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site is a time-honored place in which President Kim Il Sung guided a battle to victory during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					It is located in the town of Pochon County, Ryanggang Province.
					
					The battle, conducted on June 4, Juche 26 (1937), demonstrated the might of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, inspiring the Korean people suffering from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule with the belief that the Koreans were alive and that they could surely win in the fight against them.
					
					Kim Il Sung made a historic speech "Let Us Fight on Staunchly for the Liberation of the Fatherland" before Pochonbo people, encouraging them with the conviction of victory in the struggle.
					
					In order to hand down the great exploits of the President through generations, Korean people erected his statue and built the Pochonbo Revolutionary Museum in the battle site.
					
					Preserved in the site are a spot where the President had a rest with the guerrillas, Kouyushui Barrage, Konjang Hill, command post of the battle, Japanese police post, subcounty office, fire station, forest conservation office, shop, agricultural experiment station, post office, restaurant and battery built by the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: Silver Craftwork "Torch"
articles.content:
Silver Craftwork "Torch"

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a silver craftwork "Torch".
					
					It is a gift presented to leader Kim Jong Il by the Juche Idea Study Society of Indian Delhi. 
					
					The organization was formed in Sept. Juche 70 (1981), involving people of various social strata. 
					
					Society members have studied works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the Juche idea founded by the President. They have also held seminars, lectures and reading sessions on them. 
					
					Through the activities for the study of Juche idea, they learned the truth that the popular masses' cause of independence is sure to win under the banner of the Juche idea, and cherished deep reverence for Kim Jong Il, who clearly indicated the way ahead of humankind. 
					
					A delegation of the society visited Pyongyang in 1998 to take part in celebrations of the DPRK's golden anniversary, with a gift prepared with its utmost sincerity. 
					
					The silver craftwork represents the Korean people's spirit of glorifying socialist society centered on the popular masses under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, holding fast to the banner of Juche idea.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Symposium on Preservation of Natural Environment Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Symposium on Preservation of Natural Environment Held

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The national scientific and technological symposium in the field of protecting natural environment took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday. It was to mark the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Bringing about a New Turn in Land Administration".
					
					Jong Yong Nam, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Nature Conservation Union of Korea, in his opening address said that the work serves as important guidelines to be held fast in land administration.
					
					The symposium heard 17 papers of new idea and great value of introduction.
					
					Appreciated were papers which contributed to successfully settling the scientific and technological issues arising in protecting bio-ecology, preventing the environmental pollution and increasing the resources of animals and plants. Papers dealing with the ways of protecting forest and soil through combined forestry-agriculture administration and breeding new flower species were also favorably commented upon at the symposium.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Action to Cover up Truth behind "Cheonan" Sinking Case Disclosed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Action to Cover up Truth behind "Cheonan" Sinking Case Disclosed

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Sin Sang Chol, member of the joint group for investigation into the "Cheonan" ship sinking case, on Aug. 26 posted on Internet radio "Voice of People" an article on the south Korean puppet authorities' base action to hide the truth about the case.
					
					He recalled that the prosecution sued him and Seoul Central District Court put him on a trial on Aug. 22 for the mere reason that he disclosed the truth about the case.
					
					Right after the sinking, the stranded ship sent SOS signals, he said, adding that those facts were recorded in such data as the reports submitted by the navy and maritime police.
					
					The military authorities, however, kept the information about the ship's navigation and exchange of telegraphic messages and the operation of the engine from being disclosed and groundlessly ignored the ship's possibility of getting stranded and collided with other ship. 
					
					He continued:
					
					Though the bow of the ship was discovered just 9 hours after the occurrence of the case, the military told reporters a lie that the work to find the bow was still going on. Even though shell pieces and other organisms were found on the side of the wrecked torpedo, the military ignored those evidence.
					
					There are ample stories that do not match with the south Korean authorities' theory of the ship's sinking. They include the testimonies made by the survivors that they did not smell gunpowder at all, the fact that nobody witnessed the shoal of fishes dead as well as water column at the time of the ship's sinking and the fact that a fluorescent lamp and gas turbine at the place the ship was cut into two remained undamaged.
					
					This could be attributable to the ship's collision with a sub.
					
					He said that anti-sub drill being staged in the waters at issue and the video showing a certain object going against the sea current by powerful engine immediately after the break of the ship into two parts indicate the great possibility of the collision between the ship and a submarine.
					
					He said he revealed the facts at a trial, expressing his will to exert efforts to disclose the truth about the case in the future, too.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Accused of Deliberately Delaying Work to Salvage Sunken Warship
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Accused of Deliberately Delaying Work to Salvage Sunken Warship

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military authorities was disclosed to have deliberately delayed the work to rescue warship "Cheonan" after its sinking. This has sparked off public criticism.
					
					This was disclosed by the section chief in charge of transportation of the munitions staff of the south Korean navy who made a testimony at a trial of Sin Sang Chol, a member of the joint investigation team on August 22.
					
					According to him, it was urgent to bring cranes to the spot in order to pull up the sunken warship but the military authorities let the transportation section specializing in the management of motorcar insurance do the job.
					
					The transportation section wasted away many days, getting familiar with the NGOs' possession of cranes through several channels and taking measures. As a result, it could start the rescue operation only after 5 days.
					
					Sin Sang Chol said that the naval authorities had already concluded that all the seamen of the warship might have died within 5 or 10 minutes after its sinking and that they had no intention to carry out immediate salvage operation.
					
					A journalist who covered the trial said that he was skeptical as to whether the military had real intention to rescue their servicepersons or not.

articles.title: S. Koreans Wage Actions against Lay-Off
articles.content:
S. Koreans Wage Actions against Lay-Off

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Laid-off workers of the Ssangryong Motor Co. Ltd. and the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd. and other people from all walks of life waged actions against the "government" in Seoul on Saturday and Sunday demanding it retract the lay-off measure and withdraw part-time job system.
					
					A candlelight rally was held at Chonggye Square in Seoul on Saturday.
					
					The speakers blamed the enterprise side for enforcing the wholesale dismissal in pursuit of profits, thus pushing the workers to death.
					
					But the present regime is siding by the conglomerates and enforcing the policy against the workers, they said.
					
					They declared their will to pool the efforts of people of all strata and wage a dynamic struggle until the lay-off measure is retracted and the traitorous "government" is punished.
					
					They held another rally at Tokripmun Park on Sunday.
					
					They accused the security authorities of deploying 110 companies of police forces around Chongwadae building, creating terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					They would keep their actions for their vital rights, they said.
					
					After the rally they staged a demonstration march.

articles.title: Withdrawal of Statue of Former Dictator Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Statue of Former Dictator Urged in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News in an article on August 27 called for withdrawing the statue of Syngman Rhee who earned an ill fame as heinous sycophantic traitor and dictator.
					
					The article said:
					
					Many things done by the present regime since its appearance while letting loose a spate of flowery words were common in their illegality.  A ceremony of unveiling the statue of Syngman Rhee held in Seoul on August 25 is a typical example.
					
					It is quite illogical to hold the unveiling ceremony in view of the crude violation of democracy perpetrated by Syngman Rhee and the circumstances of pulling down of his statue in Seoul during the April 19 Uprising.
					
					To rebuild his statue is illegal and an insult to those who participated in the uprising. 
					
					Another problem is that the organization which built the statue is the General Federation for Freedom backed by the "government".
					
					The federation receives billions of won from the "government" every year. The organization spent 350 million won collected from the people as taxes to build the statue.
					
					The article called for pulling down the statue at once, demanding the federation and the "government" make an apology to the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Fascist Law Rejected
articles.content:
S. Korean Fascist Law Rejected

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean people are strongly calling for the repeal of the "National Security Law", the treacherous and anti-reunification fascist law.
					
					The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) in its statement on August 15 said that recently intensified in south Korea is crackdown on the people on charges of praising and encouraging the north (article 7), one of the most vicious articles of NSL.
					
					The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Media and Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration and other organizations comprising people of various strata in their statements warned that the authorities would be punished by the people for their anti-reunification moves of cracking down upon the pro-reunification movement organizations and progressives on charges of violation of the fascist law.
					
					The Bar Association for Democratic Society and the People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "National Security Law" published the "2008-2010 report on NSL". Clarified in the report was rapidly increasing number of those who were charged for violating the NSL. The number increased from 35 in 2006 to 39 in 2007. Since the emergence of the present regime it reached 40 in 2008, 70 in 2009 and 151 in 2010.
					
					Urging the need to abolish the law the report went on:
					
					Many organizations including the Emergency Meeting for Coping with the NSL and the Inchon Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions, victims of the NSL, youth and students and members of the movement organizations for reunification and others from all walks of life disclosed the brutality of the NSL and demanded the repeal of the law.
					
					It is shame on the nation that the evil law still remains in force, inciting the permanent division of the nation and cracking down on the patriotic personages standing for reunification, said media including the Internet newspaper Jaju Minbo and Internet radio "Voice of People", calling for the earlier abolition of the NSL.

articles.title: Songun Politics Lauded
articles.content:
Songun Politics Lauded

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Lectures, seminars, round-table talks, film shows and photo exhibitions were held in Italy, the Czech Republic, Thailand, Bangladesh, India, Indonesia, Myanmar, Malaysia and Nigeria from Aug. 19 to 23 on the 51st anniversary of start of Songun revolutionary leadership by Kim Jong Il.
					
					On display in the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos, books and magazines on their immortal exploits and photos of the invincible might of Songun Korea.
					
					Films shown included "Arms of Korea," "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu".
					
					Osvaldo Pesce, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, said that socialism of the DPRK which put forward the army as the main force will always emerge victorious.
					
					Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, said that Kim Jong Il is a peerlessly brilliant commander with gifted military wisdom, strategy and tactics and outstanding commanding art and that as long as there is the Songun leadership the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia will be firmly safeguarded.
					
					M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other speakers noted that the Songun leadership is the traditional leadership mode in Korea. Reality of several countries helped them realize that the Songun politics is the most perfect political mode, they added.
					
					M. Gamrul Huda, chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, spoke highly of Kim Jong Il who has brilliantly carried forward the Songun idea and exploits of Kim Il Sung. Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism and advanced victoriously the Juche revolution in reliance upon the strong military power, he added.
					
					Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in India.

articles.title: Songun Politics, Best Way of Defending Sovereignty of Country
articles.content:
Songun Politics, Best Way of Defending Sovereignty of Country

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations of France and Britain posted on their Internet homepages articles on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The France-Korea Friendship Association on August 23 carried an article with a photo of Kim Jong Il inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army. The article said:
					
					The Songun politics of the DPRK is a political mode putting forward the military affairs as the most important state affair. It calls for defending the country, revolution and socialism by relying on the revolutionary disposition and combat power of the KPA and accelerating socialist construction with the KPA as the main force.
					
					In the DPRK the army precisely represents the party, the state and the people.
					
					It is thanks to the Songun politics that the DPRK has turned into a fortress of independence which any formidable enemy dares not provoke. This clearly proves that the Songun politics is the best way for defending the sovereignty of the country and the nation today when the high-handed and arbitrary practices on the part of the imperialists have become all the more pronounced.
					
					The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on August 22 in an article said that Songun Korea, which is putting forward the KPA as the pillar of the revolution, is displaying its might and dignity.

articles.title: DPRK's Songun Politics Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Songun Politics Praised by Foreign Papers

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The Indian paper Krishna Aberta on August 22 devoted one whole page to articles under the headline "On the 51st anniversary of the great leader HE Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership" with his photo.
					
					The paper carried articles under the subtitles "Songun and Kim Jong Il", "Leader and vanguard unit" and "Reason why war has not broken out on Korean Peninsula". It introduced in detail that the Songun politics pursued by him has laid a firm groundwork for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and it is an effective political mode for the regional peace and security.
					
					The Cambodian paper Kmae Amata on August 22 carried an article with a photo of him inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army. The article said that the political, ideological, military and technological might of the KPA has been put on the high level thanks to his 50 odd year-long Songun leadership.
					
					The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on August 21 carried an article headlined "DPRK attaches importance to military affairs" with a photo of him inspecting a KPA unit.
					
					The international position of the DPRK has been remarkably enhanced under his Songun leadership, the paper said, adding that progressive figures of many countries are praising the Songun politics of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Reported by Guinean Radios
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Reported by Guinean Radios

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Guinean radios reported commemorative programs on August 15, the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					It is President Kim Il Sung who led the anti-Japanese war to victory and liberated Korea, the domestic radio said.
					
					His feats in Korea's liberation is that he saved the Korean people from the destiny of colonial slavery, put forward them as full-fledged master of the country and laid an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the Korean nation, it stressed.
					
					It aired: His feats are shining brilliantly thanks to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Kim Jong Il has developed in depth the Songun idea and applied it to all fields, thus firmly defending socialism centred on the popular masses built by the President, and opening a new turn in building a thriving nation.
					
					It is thanks to Kim Jong Il that the desire of the President who devoted his whole life to accomplishing the people's cause of independence has been translated into reality.
					
					The President's feats in Korea's liberation will shine long.
					
					The international radio also reported the same contents.

articles.title: U.S. Aim to Interfere into Disputes over Designation of East Sea of Korea Disclosed
articles.content:
U.S. Aim to Interfere into Disputes over Designation of East Sea of Korea Disclosed

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. in a recent letter to the International Hydrographic Organization clarified its official stand that the East Sea of Korea should be marked as "Japan Sea."
					
					Minju Joson Tuesday in a bylined commentary terms it a blatant challenge to the sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					It says:
					
					It is quite illogical for the U.S. to interfere in disputes over the designation of the East Sea of Korea.
					
					It has been marked as "Japan Sea" since the Japanese imperialists illegally occupied Korea and enforced a colonial rule over it. They not only occupied Korea but deprived it of its sea and renamed it theirs.
					
					After Korea put an end to Japan's colonial rule and achieved its independence, it should have taken back the original name of the East Sea of Korea. This is a main principle in international relations and it also stands to reason from a logical point of view.
					
					Nevertheless, the U.S. has patronized Japan's brigandish assertion on "Japan Sea" in a bid to attain a sinister intention.
					
					Lurking behind the above-said assertion is Japan's ambition to stage a militarist comeback. U.S. intention is to fan up war hysteria of the Japanese reactionaries who are buoyed by ambition for militarist overseas expansion and drag them more deeply in its strategy for domination over Asia.
					
					Japan is miscalculated if it thinks it can do anything as it pleases backed by the U.S.
					
					"Japan Sea" did not exist in the past and will never exist in the future, either.
					
					There exits only East Sea of Korea on the earth.
					
					The Korean people will protect their inviolable sea to the last and never make any compromise over the matter.

articles.title: U.S. Economic Depression
articles.content:
U.S. Economic Depression

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. economy is gasping for fresh air.
					
					The S＆P, an international credit account organization, announced early in August that it would degrade the U.S. credit level.
					
					The federal budgetary deficit tripled to 129 billion dollars in July from the previous month, the U.S. Department of Treasury said on August 10 quoting investigation data.
					
					The U.S. total budgetary deficit stood at 1 099.9 billion dollars for 10 months in the current fiscal year which began October last year.
					
					The S＆P announcement did great harm to the U.S. economy.
					
					Many economists admitted that the degradation of the U.S. credit level would arouse concern about the "second decline" of the U.S. economy as it would give shocking impact to its markets.
					
					Analysts clarified that there existed the necessity of the degradation and it led to the exposure of the inveterate defects that undermined the U.S. credit foundation such as its way of consumption, deficit policy and political in-fighting.
					
					The public assesses that the present U.S. economy can be likened to a patient who looks healthy with the help of an oxygen respirator.
					
					Much upset by the serious economic crisis going unresolved, the present Administration tried to settle the fund issue and defuse the crisis by raising the legally restricted state debt limit.
					
					But this led to fierce factional strife between the Democratic Party and the Republican Party at a Congressional session this year.
					
					The U.S. public judges that lurking behind it is a politically-motivated aim to get benefits from the election due next year.
					
					A serious warning is issued against the U.S. economic mode based on loan.
					
					The U.S. debt running to the astronomical figure and financial crisis are chiefly attributable to its unilateralism and hegemonism, aggression and interference in internal affairs of other countries all over the world on which it spent a huge amount of money.
					
					The U.S. economy, being pushed into a quagmire as the days go by, vividly shows the wretched plight of the world's "only superpower" going downhill.

articles.title: Hurricane Irene Blamed for 8 deaths
articles.content:
Hurricane Irene Blamed for 8 deaths

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Hurricane Irene, a massive and deadly storm, churned northward along the U.S. East Coast Saturday night.
					
					The Los Angeles Times reported Irene was blamed for at least eight deaths in North Carolina, Virginia and Florida, and had left a million customers without power. 
					
					Dwelling houses were destroyed and traffic was paralyzed.
					
					Forest fire broke out in different parts of Greece owing to recent sultry weather, causing damage.
					
					Tens of hectares of forests caught fire as of August 26 and many people went for urgent shelter.
					
					A state of emergency was declared in two severely affected regions.

articles.title: 5 Civilians Killed in NATO Airstrike in Afghan
articles.content:
5 Civilians Killed in NATO Airstrike in Afghan

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Five civilians including three women were killed when warplanes of NATO-led troops carried out an airstrike against the Taliban in Logar province, 60 km south of capital city of Kabul, a spokesman for the provincial administration said on Friday.

articles.title: Japan Ground "SDF" Conducts Live Shell Firing Exercises
articles.content:
Japan Ground "SDF" Conducts Live Shell Firing Exercises

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Japan ground "Self-Defense Force" conducted a large-scale live shell firing drills in the Higashifuji firing range on Aug. 28.
					
					Involved in the drills were about 2 400 troops, 80 tanks and armored cars, 80 artillery pieces and 30 warplanes.
					
					The drills were conducted under the simulated conditions of an actual war.

articles.title: Russia Test-Launches ICBM
articles.content:
Russia Test-Launches ICBM

					Moscow, August 29 (KCNA) -- Russia test launched Intercontinental Ballistic Missile "Bulava" in its White Sea on August 27.
					
					The warheads of the ICBMs launched from the Russian nuclear-powered submarine "Yuri Dolgoruki" successfully reached the designated waters in the Pacific.
					
					The recent launch was reportedly carried out as part of the state test for confirming the maximum flight range of the ICBMs.

articles.title: Floods Hits China, Russia
articles.content:
Floods Hits China, Russia

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Shandong Province in China suffered damage due to heavy rainfalls on August 26 and 27.
					
					Almost 710 000 mus of farmland in Zaozhuang and Linyi cities were inundated, many houses collapsed and the traffic was paralyzed.
					
					Number of victims stands at 430 000.
					
					Groznyi city in Chechnya, Russia also suffered from flood.
					
					Over 600 houses went under water, forcing at least 2 400 people to seek urgent shelter.

articles.title: National Symposium of Prosecutor's Offices Held in China
articles.content:
National Symposium of Prosecutor's Offices Held in China

					Beijing, August 29 (KCNA) -- A national symposium on investigation and supervision of prosecutor's offices was held in the Chinese city of Xining, Qinghai Province on Aug. 25 and 26.
					
					The symposium reviewed experience and lessons gained in the work of investigation and supervision and emphasized the need to ensure the leadership of the Communist Party in this work.

articles.title: China's Measure for Helping Nonage Wanderers
articles.content:
China's Measure for Helping Nonage Wanderers

					Beijing, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Public Security called for combating nonage abduction and coercion.
					
					In a notice released recently, the ministry said the public security agencies at all levels should strictly observe the rule of helping and protecting nonage wanderers and closely cooperate with organs concerned.
					
					They also have to improve information exchange, make a deep study of the situation and solve problems in cooperation with each other, it added.

articles.title: U.S. Should Fulfill Its Commitments: Article
articles.content:
U.S. Should Fulfill Its Commitments: Article

					Beijing, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Xinhua News Agency recently reported an article urging the United States to fulfill its  commitments.   
					
					During his recent China visit, the U.S. vice-president said he had confidence in the security of dollar and the U.S. economic prospect and that the U.S. would never fail to implement its commitments. In this regard, the article said such confidence could be guaranteed only by responsible practice.     
					
					In order to keep its promise, the U.S. should put an end to excessive dependence on foreign loans, launch reforms, decrease the budgetary deficit and remodel the economic structure, the article noted.     
					
					It is high time that the U.S. showed the world its decision, ability and political will not only to make a promise but to keep it, the article added.

articles.title: Cuba Keeps Reviving Rail Sector
articles.content:
Cuba Keeps Reviving Rail Sector

					Havana, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Industrial Fixtures Company has produced 104, 000 concrete sleepers up to present as part of the strategy to revive Cuba's rail sector, according to Prensa Latina on Aug. 25.
					
					The head of that enterprise, based in the province of Villa Clara, noted that this figure covers more than half of the planned number of concrete sleepers to be built this year.

articles.title: Turkey Intensifies Battle with Drug Smuggling
articles.content:
Turkey Intensifies Battle with Drug Smuggling

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- 485 kilograms of hashish was seized and five smugglers were arrested in Diyarbakir of Turkey on Aug. 25.
					
					That day nearly 200 kg of hashish was seized and nine criminals were arrested in Adana of the country.

articles.title: Mugabe Urges Use of Green Technology to Boost Economy
articles.content:
Mugabe Urges Use of Green Technology to Boost Economy

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe on Friday urged use of appropriate green technologies in order to put the country's economy on a sustainable growth path.
					
					The president said focus should also be placed on environment conservation to mitigate effects of climate change and ensure agriculture, a major driver of the economy, grows on a sustainable basis.
					
					Mugabe underscored the importance of greening the economy.

articles.title: Efforts to Prevent HIV/AIDS in Zambia
articles.content:
Efforts to Prevent HIV/AIDS in Zambia

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Zambia mapped out a new plan to prevent the spread of HIV/AIDS recently.
					
					According to the plan, the government of the country is to purchase and supply medicines needed for about 410 000 AIDs cases in 2 years.
					
					The government will scale up access to treatment by creating 68 new antiretroviral therapy sites and supplying drugs to all 454 existing ART sites throughout the country.

articles.title: Iranian President: No Place for Israel in Region
articles.content:
Iranian President: No Place for Israel in Region

					Tehran, August 29 (KCNA) -- Rallies were held in many cities including Tehran in Iran in support of the establishment of the Palestinian independent state on the occasion of the International Quds Day.
					
					Millions of Iranians participated in the rallies in cities and towns across Iran.
					
					Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in his speech at a rally expressed full support and solidarity to the Palestinians' cause, adding that there will be no room for Israel in the region.
					
					He also called on Palestinians to unite to establish the powerful independent state.

articles.title: Zionists' Survival Contrasts Human Dignity, Independence
articles.content:
Zionists' Survival Contrasts Human Dignity, Independence

					Tehran, August 29 (KCNA) -- President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said on Friday that Zionist regime's establishment and survival are in contrast with human dignity and independence. 
					
					Delivering his Friday prayers congregation pre-sermon address, President Ahmadinejad said Zionist regime's existence is not merely a threat to the Palestinian and the entire regional nations, rather its establishment and continued survival contrast interests, independence and dignity of all regional nations. 
					
					He said the prelude to establishment of the regime was lies and deception.

articles.title: Recent Situation in Sudan Arouses Concern
articles.content:
Recent Situation in Sudan Arouses Concern

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- South Sudan announced its independence on July 9.
					
					The UN General Assembly on Thursday adopted a resolution recognizing the country and allowed its entry into the United Nations as the 193rd member. As a result, the 54th country made its appearance in Africa.
					
					Analysts are concerned that the relations between the Republic of Sudan and the newly-born Republic of South Sudan will get complicated due to such acute and outstanding issues as settlement of border, division of debt and oil revenue and status of Christians in the north and Arabians in the south.
					
					In particular, the two countries are laying territorial claims to five regions including Southern Kordofan and Blue Nile rich in oil, sparking off conflicts again in the regions.
					
					75 percent of oil boring stations with 500 000 bb1 of production capacity is located in South Sudan while most of oil refineries, oil pipelines and export ports are in North Sudan. Therefore, how to divide the profits from oil sales has become a crucial issue.
					
					The Sudanese government asserts that South Sudan should pay one third of income from oil in return for using ports, refineries and oil pipelines in the north. On the other hand, South Sudan blames North Sudan for provoking an economic war by levying heavy taxes on oil exported through its ports.
					
					South Sudan, home to 8 million, covers over 650 000 square kilometers. It faces not only economic issues including lack of talents and weak infrastructures but such political challenges as growing difference of views among inner political factions.
					
					The international community looks forward to an earlier solution to the issues between Sudan and South Sudan by their own efforts free from foreign forces' interference in the internal affairs.

articles.title: Spain Passes Fresh Measures to Promote Employment
articles.content:
Spain Passes Fresh Measures to Promote Employment

					Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Spanish Cabinet on Friday approved a series of measures aiming at combating the high level of youth unemployment in the country.
					
					Almost 4 079 000 Spaniards were registered as unemployed at the end of July with one in three of those a youngster.

articles.title: En Pyongyang la delegacion de agencia noticiera japonesa Kyodo
articles.content:
En Pyongyang la delegacion de agencia noticiera japonesa Kyodo

					Pyongyang, 30 de agosto (ACNC) -- Arribo el dia 30 a esta capital por via aerea la delegacion de la agencia noticiera japonesa Kyodo y sus filiales presidida por el presidente Satoshi Ishikawa.

articles.title: Sin Sang Chol revela acto grosero de autoridades en el caso de "Cheonan"
articles.content:
Sin Sang Chol revela acto grosero de autoridades en el caso de "Cheonan"

					Pyongyang, 30 de agosto (ACNC) -- Sin Sang Chol, quien era miembro del grupo de investigacion conjunta del caso de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan", publico el dia 26 en la radioemisora surcoreana online "Voz del Pueblo" un articulo revelando la bajeza de las autoridades titeres encaminada a encubrir el verdadero aspecto del incidente.
					
					En su articulo Sin se refirio a que por haber aclarado la verdad, la fiscalia le acuso y el Tribunal Local Central de Seul le sometio al juicio el dia 22.
					
					Sostuvo que inmediatamente despues de ocurrido el incidente, la corbeta envio el senal de auxilio por la varada, lo cual esta registrado al pie de la letra en los datos incluso los informes de las fuerzas navales y la policia maritima.
					
					A pesar de ello, las autoridades militares surcoreanas dejaron en secreto los registros de navegacion y comunicacion y el estado de funcionamiento del motor, que deben ser  publicados, y excluyeron sin ningun fundamento el rumor de varada y choque, critico.
					
					Ademas, a pesar de que fue descubierta la proa de la corbeta al cabo de 9 horas despues del hundimiento, las autoridades militares mintieron a los periodistas que seguian la busqueda, recalco y prosiguio que cuando fueron descubiertos los seres biologicos pegados en las arruinas del torpedo, elimino los testigos.
					
					Las palabras de los subsistentes de que nunca olian a polvora, el hecho de que nadie vio el fenomeno de muerte en manada de peces ni la columna de aguas y la conservacion como de origen de la lampara fluorescente y la turbina de gas que estaban en el plano de recorte, etc. niegan el rumor de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" por la explosion, en que insisten tanto la autoridades, asevero.
					
					Insistio en que la causa principal del hundimiento de la corbeta se debe al choque con un submarino.
					
					Es porque en aquel entonces en la zona maritima, donde ocurrio el incidente, se desarrollaba el ejercicio anti-submarino con la participacion de los submarinos y que en el video de explicacion sobre el estado de hundimiento, fue descubierto un objeto que avanzaba a contrapelo de la corriente del mar con la fuerza del motor fuerte en el momento de recorte de la corbeta, asevero.
					
					Destaco que a traves del juicio revelo todos los hechos y expreso su decision de seguir esforzandose en el futuro tambien por aclarar la verdad del caso.

articles.title: Revelada dilatacion intencional de socorro de corbeta "Cheonan"
articles.content:
Revelada dilatacion intencional de socorro de corbeta "Cheonan"

					Pyongyang, 30 de agosto (ACNC) -- El hecho de que en el momento del hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" las autoridades militares surcoreanas dilataron intencionalmente el socorro de este buque de guerra, causa gran escandalo social.
					
					Lo revelo el dia 22 el jefe de seccion de transporte del Estado Mayor de Municiones de las fuerzas navales titeres, quien se presento en el juicio publico como testigo de Sin Sang Chol, miembro del grupo de investigacion conjunta.
					
					Segun su confesion, era perentorio traer la grua en el lugar de accidente para arrancar la corbeta hundida, pero las autoridades militares lo dejaron a cargo de la seccion de transporte, que se encargaba principalmente del proceso de seguro de carros.
					
					Como resultado, la seccion de transporte, no especializada, perdio muchos dias para tomar las medidas luego de enterarse del estado de posesion de grua de las empresas civiles a traves de varias vias, y comenzo el socorro al cabo de 5 dias despues del surgimiento del accidente.
					
					Por otra parte, Sin Sang Chol aclaro que en aquel entonces, las autoridades del ejercito naval sacaron la conclusion de que a 5-10 minutos del hundimiento de la corbeta, todos los tripulantes habrian muerto y no tenian ninguna opinion de salvarlos de inmediato.
					
					Ese dia, un hombre de la prensa, que estuvo presente en el juicio, expreso la sospecha de que la capa militar surcoreana pensaba en salvar realmente la vida de los oficiales y soldados tripulantes.
